events.title: Battle of Waterloo
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte was defeated by the Duke of Wellington and Prussian forces under Gebhard Leberecht von Bl√ºcher, ending the Napoleonic Wars.
events.significance: This battle marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars and reshaped the political landscape of Europe for decades.

events.title: United States Declares War on Britain (War of 1812)
events.description: The United States Congress declared war on the United Kingdom due to trade restrictions and maritime rights violations.
events.significance: Start of the War of 1812, a pivotal conflict that asserted U.S. sovereignty and affected North American geopolitics.

events.title: Winston Churchill's 'This was their finest hour' Speech
events.description: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill delivered a famous speech to the House of Commons rallying the British people during the Battle of Britain.
events.significance: This speech helped boost British morale during World War II amid the threat of Nazi invasion.

events.title: Sally Ride Becomes First American Woman in Space
events.description: Astronaut Sally Ride flew aboard the Space Shuttle Challenger, becoming the first American woman to travel into space.
events.significance: A major milestone in space exploration and gender equality in STEM fields.

events.title: Aswan High Dam Agreement Signed
events.description: Egypt signed a plan to build the Aswan Dam with Soviet assistance amid Western refusal to finance the project.
events.significance: Marked an important point in Cold War politics and Egyptian modernization efforts.
